description: Food is delicious. Great ambience and friendly environment. Food came out fast and the food is soooo good!!!!
author: Kimberly R.

description:
It's not relevant to comment on the food or drink one bit in this review--because I will never ever come back due to a totally separate issue. I was sitting down for dinner, late on a Friday--I live nearby and this is one of the only spots that offer food late. Had never been before. 

Five minutes later a woman walked in and joined her friends at the hi top table next to mine--bringing in her large labradoodle. At 1100 at night. In a busy bar. That was serving food. without asking fellow diners if they were cool. My dinner was ruined with a large dog 2 feet from me.

Some people have bad experiences with dogs or animals as a kid. A lot more than you would think. The staff did literally zero and didnt enforce standard city health codes .

I will never return.
author: alex v.

description: Cold fries. Asked for napkins, they were picked up off the floor. Inattentive service. Beer was acceptable. The location is great and atmosphere is okay.
author: Rob E.

description: Nice, unpretentious cocktail bar and lounge.  I wouldn't call it a "pub" as it's labeled in Yelp - it's more quiet and casual.  There's even a nice seating area in the back where it's quieter.  I haven't tried the food yet, but I really loved the barrel aged cocktails, especially the old fashioned.
author: Greg B.

description:
I have been to The Liberties a few times since moving to Noe Valley for both food and drinks. This review is mostly for food based on my experience last night. I will however say that the cocktails here are good, if not a bit pricy for the atmosphere ($11-$13 a drink). The drink list is pretty big, though, and they have a lot of beer and wine which is more reasonably priced. It's definitely a solid neighborhood spot for any occasion.

Anyways, onto the food! We came in last night for a late dinner after Game 7 of the World Series. Being 10pm on a Wednesday night, there were not that many open options if you didn't want a Burrito or Pizza. Luckily, the kitchen at The Liberties is open until 1 AM every night! The menu is pretty big with appetizers, salads, entrees and pizza, all for reasonable prices. Do note, however, that the menu is different than what is online. It seems like they have added a few items like salads and a few more appetizers and entrees but the prices are relatively the same. 

The Liberties has a special on Wednesday for $3 sliders (Pork, Lamb or Beef) and Whiskey Flights. We both opted for sliders after having drank enough during the game. I personally had a Pork Slider ($3) and Fried Brussels Sprouts with Parmesan, Bacon and Capers ($7) Kosher, right ; ) . My boyfriend had 1 of each type of slider for a total of $9. It took a somewhat long time to get our food (~20-25 minutes) but it was worth it! The sliders were the perfect size and each had their own flavor. Both of us loved the pork sliders because they were well-seasoned and satisfying. Both the lamb and beef sliders were perfectly moist and tasty as well. The brussels sprouts, though, were UNREAL. I usually am not into heavy, greasy food but this may have changed my ways. They were so satisfying, delicious and zesty. My heart may have exploded but I definitely could have had another order.

We will definitely be back! In addition to the Wednesday specials, they also do Taco and Tequila Tuesdays, Brunch and nice Happy Hour. We are lucky to live near by as I see us coming even more often now that we know the food is good.
author: Carrie W.

description:
My partner and I, sat at a table for 20 minutes. We weren't acknowledged. Why? We may never know but... Why bother - to know. Even the bartender ignored us until we decided to leave. 

Poor lazy service or some kind of prejudice? Who cares.
author: Bulldog W.

description:
I don't think I've had a gross burger... in my life. I imagine it's difficult to make a 'gross' burger, but this place managed to do it. I honestly thought it went bad. There was an odd smell coming from the container. I opened it up and took a bite. Yuck. Seriously, avoid this place. It's pretty bad.

I'll update this if I get food poisoning, because I'm honestly beginning to think I might. In the meantime, I'll double check with my lawyer regarding my will and ensure all my finances are in place in the possibility this place becomes the end of me.
author: Cornelius V.

description:
I love The Liberties. 

It's location alone bears honorable mention. It's sort of off the beaten path, so you do not get the ridiculous that goes along with going to bars in the Mission. 

Even though you don't generally need to make a reservation, you can easily make one on Open Table and get the points for doing so. 

You can go to The Liberties for brunch, lunch, dinner, or happy hour.  Personally, I love to go on Taco Tuesday. Surprisingly, they make delicious tacos! And on the cheap. Only on Tuesday (and not the rest of the week), they have fish, carne asada, shrimp and I think carnitas tacos, but don't quote me. They are all really good! If you're into bar eats, I also love their tater tots, samosas, and French fries. 

The Liberties also makes a solid yet delightful cocktail. I have had the Clash, the Pink Gun and the Loaded Mule. My boyfriend likes the Pink Gun, but he has the bartender make it in a tumbler with ice, so he can stay secure in his manhood. The Loaded Mule is just a Moscow Mule made with Crabbies alcoholic ginger beer.... Yay girl, yay! 

The Liberties is also a good place to watch sports ball, if you are into that sort of thing. The sports ball crowd here isn't as obnoxious as most. They are a little older and wiser, so no yelling at televisions. 

The bartenders are really nice. The service is solid.  It's an all around good experience.
author: Sunny S.

description:
I was looking forward to trying the food & drink here, unfortunately we walked out after being completely ignored by the staff for nearly ten minutes. No, the place wasn't busy, the staff were just rude, or useless, or both. 

When I say "ignored" I meant the staff didn't even *look* at us, let alone acknowledge our presence. It's not hard--all they had to do was say, "be right with you" and do their best. 

Instead we left hungry and pissed off. I doubt we'll bother to try again.
author: Josh A.

description:
I absolutely love when you have food so good, you have to take to yelp to rave about it. I've ordered from Liberties multiple times but was skeptical of a place that serves such good pulled pork sandwiches AND pizza. So for my first couple of order's I played it safe with the burger, pulled pork sandwiches and delicious sweet potato tater' tots. 

Boy was I wrong! 

I decided to go out on a limb and wow did it pay off! The bacon, asparagus, and goat cheese pizza is one of the best pies I've had in San Francisco. Now I'm no pizza expert by far but I've had my fare share of delfina-esk pizzaria's peppered throughout the city at $25 a pie and this $16 pizza blew my mind. 

Now of course you could say that yes, bacon with  cheese is an easy winner but that's not what set it apart. 

#1) As a lactose intolerant person, cheap dairy makes me super sick. Not the case with this pizza.(this pie has goat cheese and (cow) mozzerella too, to clarify) No overwhelming feeling of regret triggered by a grumbling stomach accompanying a stomach ache from hell. Just pleasant overstuffed fullness. 

#2) The asparagus was cooked really well, not too chewy but enough of crunch still left to offer something unique, palate wise. The tomatoes halved on top were also a tasty addition. 

#3) Now for the real reason I had to write this review. What makes an exceptionally good pie to me at least is the sauce and the crust. As I had already ate half the pie in shear hunger, I began to pick up on the smaller details that you start to discern once your basic hunger is satiated. What happened is that I couldn't stop eating this pizza. I had planned on saving some for "cold pizza breakfast" the next morning (Yes I'm one of those weirdos who loves cold pizza, so if this nullifies my opinion's and my existence in general to you, then so be it. *Hair flip*) 

I'm such a hard person to please when it comes to sauce and it just hit it out of the ball park. It just tasted so fresh! The sweetness was there but also the spices come subtly through, just fantastic. I think the mistake restaurants make is thinking that people won't be able to taste the difference between quality ingredients. Not true. Once you've had vegetables, fruit, food, ect. from quality sources like Bi-rite, your palate is just never the same. And if they use cheap stuff, well the chef must be spinning safeway shit into bi-rite tasting quality gold in the kicthen. It tasted like the real deal to me. The ratio of sauce to cheese was also very appreciated.


THE CRUST. I could eat just the crust till the end of time. It tasted as if the crust was brushed with olive oil, garlic, salt, and corn meal with a splash of butter too! It's the way I think all crusts should taste like. Also sprinkled throughout the pizza was chili flakes! Just a tad bit of spice in contrast with the sweeter ingredient of the pizza. 

Anywho, the food here at minimum seems thought out and well executed. I enjoyed the pleasant pizza surprise and I'll have to actually make it into the physical location one day to see the wizards at work.
author: Ulysses X.

description: Good place for an Irish beer. Also decent mixed drinks, and a chill vibe.
author: Oleg H.

description:
This has been THE bar my friends and I go to for happy hours and WARRIORS Game. ( It's like the bar where ted from How I met your mother frequents with his friends)

Been here several times! Let me tell you what is RAD:
Mac and cheese
ALL THE FRIES ( tater tot was fried well, but i hate tater tots! But i LOVE french fries)
Cock and Bull Ginger Beer! ( absolutely delicious)

What are misses:
Margarita- was a bit bland/diluted
the pizza- definitely not a fan.
side vegetables
brussel sprouts ( maybe I"m just not a fan)

But, with all the misses, I"LL still come back because TED always came back to his BAR!
author: Josie H.

description: quiet local bar/pub with good bourbon drinks and a friendly bartender.  Wish they had more 'regular' beers on tap but a good place where you can actually talk and be heard.
author: David G.

description:
I'm done. I will not be back here for a long time. 

$52 for two burgers, and two beers.  

I asked for my burger medium-well. It came out charred. Completely crisp on the outside, it makes me wonder if it was just deep fried because it was dripping in oil. 

On other occasions that I have come here and had pizza (which, I wouldn't recommend), it has tasted like cheap frozen pizza. The crust could improve dramatically, as well as the marinara sauce. 

Since 2014 The Liberties has undergone a major shift. This used to be a spot where a lot of the neighborhood would come and hangout.  Now on any given night, you will find a very empty bar/dining room, with the ever changing staff hurriedly entering "Uber Eats" orders, while the actually in person patrons receive sub par service. Also, replacing quality bar stools, with casino like chairs was a true WTF? move when it happened. 

The staff has changed dramatically. Every time I come in here, there is an entirely new team of servers and bartenders. The Liberties used to be the place where "everybody knows your name". For two people who live 1.5 blocks away, it was nice to have staff who knew your name, and your order. 

The food was always "okay", but the staff and atmosphere made up for this. 

The owner has decided to focus on things that do not matter, driving away clientele.  

If you want to improve anything start with the food. Then look at why your staff keeps leaving.
author: Erin J.

description:
LIBERTIES is...

...A mellow neighborhood vibe.
...A birthday drink.
...A date.
...A catch up with a college friend.
...A weeknight dinner with hubby.

...Taco Tuesdays.
...Pub Trivia back in the day.
...An aggravating board game.
...Watching Obama election results.

...St. Paddy's "amateur night."
...Memories of a rowdy, big hearted Irish bartender.
...A shot called "Redheaded Slut."

...Mediocre brunch.
...Solid late night eats.

...Discovering Crabbie's ginger beer.
...A Veggie Burger topped with mushroom and avocado.
...Sweet Potato Fries slathered in ketchup.  

...My happy place.


(Dedicated to MB, GL, and G).
author: Amy C.

description: Walked by this place and decided to drop by for a drink and some food for my friend. I was really attracted to the atmosphere. I like the liveliness of the clientele. The menu is neat...a more expensive bar. The drink list is extensive. I just got a curiosity cola. My friend got the funghi pizza and I tried a slice. It's very loud here.
author: Denise C.

description: I love Liberties. The food and drink menus are great and everything tastes absolutely delicious. I come to liberties often with my family and my book club and my friends. I always get the chicken curry but every other dish always looks great - I just love the curry! It's so perfect. Staff and service have always been lovely. Bathrooms are huge and clean. Liberties takes reservations. I look forward to my next visit :-)
author: Michael S.

description:
I have literally never posted a negative review.  I cannot help myself with this one.  Apparently this restaurant refuses to return your full change because, they "don't, um, like, carry any change."  Wait, what?

I went in tonight to pick up a pizza for takeout (late, no energy to cook, yada).  The waitress handed me the check in one of those restaurant billfold things.  It was 16.31, so I gave the waitress a $20.  She handed back my change, again in the billfold and said "Thanks, good night" and walked away.  I opened the bill fold to $3.  I looked at it and thought, 'Huh, she decided to keep the .69 cents as a tip.  That's weird.  She could have told me that.  Funny, cause I probably would have given her a dollar or two as a tip.  But she really should have told me.'  

So I said, "Excuse me.  You know, you didn't give me my full change."

She said, "Yeah."  Not the bat of an eye.  

I said, "You could have told me that. I understand why you probably did it, but you could have told me and not just assumed."

She said, "I gave you $3."  Still, she appears either not to understand or simply not to care.

I said, "Yeah, but you owed me $3.69."

She said, "But I gave you $3.  That's just what we do."  Huh???

I said, "You didn't give me my change.  You don't give change?"

She said, "Yeah, that's just what we do.  Cause we don't, um, like, carry change."

Mind you, I am standing at the bar in front of a cash register.  

I could not have this conversation any longer and I could not have cared less about the 69 cents, so I repeated that she should let customers know, that it was too bad because I would have given her a bigger tip, and left.  

But, dammit, I had to write this review because there are rules, people!  A restaurant cannot refuse to return change -- or refuse to carry change for some incomprehensible reason -- without losing customers.  Needless to say, I won't go back.  Which is too bad since I live a block away.  But I guess I'm in a boycotting kind of mood these days...

Also, to be clear, I was a waitress for years and know they live on their tips.  I tip generously.  I also know how you treat customers and you don't steal their money, to their face, with no shame.
author: Sara N.

description:
Really disappointed with the food here. The pizza dough is comparable to the pizza at 711 while the cheese actually tasted like rubber. On a margherita pizza those 2 ingredients are kind of important to get right or at least edible being that they are basically all there is. So pizza was horrible, we look to the Mac and cheese to save the night. No luck. Might have been the worst macaroni and cheese I have ever had. The truffled french fries were the only food item we had that was halfway decent. And even still they were hardly worth 9 dollars. 

The cocktails we had were really good though! Its a shame the food was such garbage
author: Nelson S.

description:
Not sure why this place only has 3.5 stars, it deserves at least a 4. 

My group of friends and I came here for Saturday brunch last weekend after a reservation snafu at another place two blocks away that has a totally undeserving 4 stars (see my review for Caffe Fiore). My friends called The Liberties before making the 5-minute walk over and they were able to accommodate us immediately. In fact, they gave us one of the two cozy long, tall tables at the back of the restaurant. The other long table was unoccupied so we felt like we had our own private space. The food was standard brunch fare, and we love the bottomless coffee! I ordered the eggs Benedict, which turned out to be pretty good. 

The only reason I took a star away (well, it was really more like 0.5 star) was because when the server took our order, she told us we could substitute the fries or potatoes for salad or toast, and many of us did. However, only after we've all made our order did she inform us that it would cost an extra $2 for each substitution. (She could have just say from the beginning that "you can sub x for y for $2", instead of trying to be all helpful and then later made us feel like she pulled one over on us. I appreciate transparency.) Anyway, I was really just nitpicking, because overall I've had a good experience here. Would come back if I were in the 'hood.
author: Mel L.

description: F U. We ordered food for 3, it was barely enough for 1. I gave your food to my dog and we went out to grab real food. Sliders suppose to come in 3 not 2 you cheap A holes
author: Aryan G.

description: I'm extremely disappointed in the staff and the management here. After hanging me $26 extra for drinks I neither ordered nor received, they refuse to respond to my emails and refund the amount. I called them the first time offering to bring in the receipt, they asked me to email it. They never replied to my email, nor my follow up email several days later. Called them again to follow up a third time, and the staff on the phone said there's nothing they can do to get me through to the owner who handles "such matters". Upon my insistence he agreed to email her from his end, and cc me, but again i never received his email. It's been two months and in the age of tech and several ways to reach a human, I haven't heard back from The Liberties. This is really disappointing.
author: Nutcrackin C.

description:
Went to this place for an event to meet up with other students.

The server was very overwhelmed with how busy the restaurant was that day. cant blame her, our table was supercramped already with 12 people. We sat at one of the back rooms

The place is super loud so wouldnt recommend if you are trying to just have a nice brunch. Felt like I had to yell to give my order to the server. My ears were ringinf by the time I left restaurant

Ended up only getting a BLT sandwich even though I wanted an omelette. The server said the kitchen was too backed up and couldnt accomodate orders with eggs because it would take too long.
author: Melinda C.

description: We used to be big fans when it was an Irish bar. The bartenders (always so pleasant ... and loved those Irish accents!) were attentive and experienced, and service was great, both at the bar and table-side.  Menu was better too. The last couple of times we've gone, we've had to pretty much wait on ourselves, ordering at the bar because no one came to our table for over 15 minutes and also picking up our orders at the bar because no one ever brought them to our table. Who knows what precipitated this change from Irish bar to run-of-the-mill bar, but it's not for the better. Still, two stars for good tater tots!
author: E. G.

description:
The only reason I'd ever want to be a celebrity is to skip lines. That's it. I mean, the paycheck must be nice, too, but really, not worth the hassle of being hounded everywhere you turn. But, oh, to be a celebrity in SF and skip all the lines. 

I can't imagine anyone being excited about waiting in line for brunch. So, imagine my delight when we walked in to Liberties and seated ourselves at noon on a Sunday for brunch. I mean... just... no words.

We opt for a Bucket o'Mimosa, which, yep, looks like this (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-liberties-bar-and-restaurant-san-francisco?select=fCju54kTt9HxiksFDhO9SA#fCju54kTt9HxiksFDhO9SA, great shot, Lili A.) and I ordered the Breakfast Pizza (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-liberties-bar-and-restaurant-san-francisco?select=fCju54kTt9HxiksFDhO9SA#xRWJPQCIUujpjiS716SQ6A). The pizza was incredible; with mozzarella, applewood bacon, scallions, marinated tomatoes, and a baked egg over the whole thing, it was tasty, filling, and had a nice crunch on the crust. The orange juice that accompanied the mimosa was freshly squeezed (with seeds and all, apparently) and included some cheapie bottle of sparkling wine (which is fine, when you're shelling out $12 for the whole deal).

Everyone else seemed to enjoy their meals just fine (the smoked salmon and breakfast burrito, I'm told, were tasty, too). Service was good and prices were fair. What really sold me was the no-wait. I can't tell you how much I hate waiting in lines. Maybe I should start work as a Sandra Bullock impersonator. ...On second thought, maybe not.
author: Adena B.

description: Don't get drinks here. Holy cow!  Horrible sazerac, horrible old fashioned, and the Manhattans are worse!   Service not so hot either.  Can't stand places that think who they are and aren't grateful for your business...
author: John F.

description: Waitress didn't seem too knowledgable on the beers while we were asking a few questions. Bartender seemed friendly enough. Their friend calamari with the hot chipotle dipping sauce is a perfect match with beer (though know what beer you want). Dark and Stormy drink made with great dark spiced rum and good ginger beer for flavor. Recommend as a stop for drinks and apps, nice ambience if you need a first date setting with dim lights and tv screens.
author: Chrissy B.

description: I ordered from this restaurant through Uber Eats, the delivery was pretty fast, the only complaint that I have is that I requested sauce on the burger, I specified on the app, and I called and confirmed that I wanted sauce on my burger, yet I received a dry burger, luckily the juiciness of the burger made up for it!!! They do not use frozen meats, and there fries are fresh cut potato by order so that's was a plus!!!  Over all experience I give them a 4 1/2 star rating.
author: Shazanna T.

description:
The Libertines Bar had a standing billboard on the sidewalk touting lamb/beef slider @2.50. sat at the bar. informed that was wednesday's special. thursday had none. 
menu looked pricey. 

ominously,  no one was eating here at lunch. so skipped the eats.

brew:  Kilkenny beer, (5.5)
-made by guinness, red ale, slightly bitter.
-good overall, many different microbrews available
4 stars for the beer/liquor selection. HH

on draught:
-lots of named liquor on shelf
-HH 3ish-5,. selected beers 3.50
-bartender m....uberfriedly
-place definitely a cool 'hood bar
-not sure about the eats.
author: Victor G.

description: Back in 3/5/12, I wrote a glowing 5 star review and enjoyed being a regular coming a few times a month and bringing friends for both dinner and brunch. My dog loved it too outside. Last night was bizarre and so bad I have to speak up. No staff to be found and then once found, we were told to seat ourselves. We had menus at our dirty table and the table next to us was dirty unset and a tons of coasters thrown around the floor. This is the area near the kitchen. I went to get a waiter after waiting ten min for him to take our order and the bartender asked if we had been seated and I said yes by him and pointed to the waiter next to her. He came and by and took out order...I ordered what I have ordered there for years so I know I pronounced it right;) ..a Kettle One Dirty Martini. He brought me a glass of clear cool liquid. His solution was to go get olives and bring them to the table to add in..there were none in the drink. That was two big strikes,  so I thought to nicely take this to the bartender to fix. She was all agressive and corrected me saying I ordered something vodka-ish that I never heard of and why was I getting all upset and unreasonable. My draw dropped, I was speaking in a soft tone and simply wanted a new drink, no favors, I said noting insulting to anyone.  I have never in my 53 years had a waiter or bartender bark at me like that for a common request.  So I asked should we just leave then ( our food was cooking, her choice  cost the place money)  and she said yes..so we did and will stay away. I miss what is used to be....sigh...
author: Sion S.

description:
I visited Liberties for the first time 2 weeks ago on Taco Tuesday and was extremely impressed.  The pulled pork tacos were absolutely amazing. This made me wonder how the rest of the food tasted?!?! Needless to say I have been back multiple times since my first visit. The samosas are absolutely killer, the burger was delicious and the skirt steak was more than I could have ever hoped for. If you are a whiskey drinker, you are in for a real treat. They have special barrel aged whiskey the owner makes herself. If you are looking for a great place to eat, at a great place with good people... Liberties is the place to go. 

Ps
Kitchen is open until 1am which makes for way better eating than pizza.


Went for brunch and it lived up to my high expectations!!!!
author: Raymond R.

description:
Excellent food!!  In the interest of full disclosure, I have never been to this bar...my partner brought food home from The Liberties, and our mouths were very happy with the result!!!

The Cream of Vegetable Soup was absolutely delicious!!!  Neither one of us has any idea which vegetables were in it, but between the pungent flavor of rosemary, a perfect salt level, and potato-thickened puree texture, we were both in heaven!!  I would order this again in a heartbeat!!!

The Bacon & Fontina Croquettes were dangerously addictive!!  Thankfully, with only five per order, split between two people, disaster was averted...this time!!!  Next time, someone may have to say a prayer for our souls, as we may ask for a double order....

The Bangers & Mash were delish, and at $14 for THREE (!!!) tasty sausages, lots of mashed potatoes, and oodles of grilled onions, it was a great deal for only $14, since it gave me enough leftovers for a whole other meal!  My only complaint was that maybe this dish was overly-drenched in pan gravy...so next time I'll probably just ask them to go light on the gravy!

My partner got the Fish & Chips...Overall he was pleased, but complained that the fries were soggy.  This is undoubtedly NOT the restaurant's fault, because this is a common issue with take-away orders...by the time you get them home and the containers opened up, the steam from the hot food has left your fries waterlogged!  Oh, well...next time we'll just have to dine in!!!

Fantastic bit of data:  The kitchen here is open until 1 am!!!!  How fantastic for those of us on a more nocturnal schedule!!!

I'll be back.  There are several items on the menu I already have my eye on, and I'll probably call ahead to find out which night they'll have that delicious soup again!!!
author: Amy L.

description:
Gotta take a star away because I have never been here when the service wasn't lax. The servers aren't rude, they just aren't very good in my experiences here. Not horrible, but no one is all that on top of their game.This doesn't really bother me but I know that for some people this is a big deal. 
Now, the good stuff. The place is clean and has a nice atmosphere. The food is pretty good, taco Tuesdays especially! The drinks are strong but not overly and they have a good liquor selection. Open late, never too crowded. This has become a go to spot.
author: Disco B.

description: This is a review from a year ago. The bar is nice, the food is ok. What I take a star or more for is the bartender comment that they weren't an Irish bar anymore. The were moving away from 'that' stereotype. As an Irish customer  i ask exactly what stereotype is that?????? Change your name while you're at it. The Liberties is a name you don't get to own with that attitude.
author: Natasha C.

description: Local favorite, Irish Bar without the rush of everyday life. Good food, great people, TVs and 15ish beers on tap with Full Bar. Clean too, not a stick to the floor kind of place. My now wife and I's first date. Because small tables and easy to talk to someone
author: Chris C.

description:
Don't sleep on Liberties! It's is a great spot tucked away in the Western Mission. They have a great range of food but I highly recommend the Mission Burger, one of the best in the Mission in my opinion. Great place to catch sports games too which is why I usually end up there. The staff is great but I have to call out Ashley who works as a waitress and has been my bartender once, she couldn't be nicer or more accommodating every time I've been there! The other staff has been great as well but my friends and I try to get into Ashley's section if she's working. Great place, definitely 5 stars for their service, food, sports and being a nice low key place to go to in the Mission since it's off the beaten path of Mission Ave or Valencia St. 

And the best part... FULLY LOADED MOSCOW MULES! Fav drink in the Mission!
author: Christina M.

description:
OK, so I made very last minute friday night plans and this place was the only one with reservations available via opentable. I shouldn't have been surprised because The Liberties was not impressive at all. To start, the service was soo slow. I mean, c'mon lady I made reservations for god's sake. My biggest pet peeve is slow service-am I the type to summon your manager? Yeah, I am. But I wasn't in an uppity mood to do so-so I begrudgingly carried on. We had a buffalo pizza, sangria, and mac n cheese. 

The pizza was really good. Buffalo sauce can make anything taste right. The sangria was on the tangier side. 

There are much better options in the Mission. Please skip.
author: Shana B.

description: This is my first time trying their food. They happened to have lamb sliders and I LOVE lamb. Not everyone can execute cooking it correctly, let alone seasoning it properly and I must say they were delicious. Juicy and seasoned very well. They paired them with peperoncinis and that made the flavor pop even more. The brussel sprouts were alright. I could have done without the parmesean cheese and capers. Not bad for bar food. I think I'll try the Mac next.
author: Omeka W.

description:
This place prides itself on its potatoes.  You want an entry into best french fries of San Francisco--this is the place.  Kennebec fries were awesome--the waitress claims the restaurant cuts it themselves.  They are the size of a pinky finger and have a little potato skin on the ends.  Just like Picadilly Fish and Chips, but way fresher oil and potatoes.  The home fries and croquettes (all from the french fry family sort of) were all excellent as well.

My burger, pretty good--solid.  The beer on tap--cooold and good.  The English Pub brunch plate--not bad as well--all very good.

I've driven by this place a million times, but only went because of a blackboard eats promo.  I was worried about the wait given prior reviews.  But since about three months ago, the waitress claims, they hired a second wait staff person (her) specifically in response to the yelp reviews.  We waited less than 15 minutes for our food on a Sunday at 1 pm.  

We sat outside and brunched.  Others had $12 pitchers of mimosas.  There was an indigent lady smoking a cigarette on the last outdoor table--had to move to get away from her smoke.  When we left, she was still there...

It's a nice vibe and a great place for those chips.
author: Philip L.

description: Classier than a dive vibe. Decent margarita. Pleasant bartender. Back room available for private party.
author: Inigo M.

description:
So strange and clean for an irish bar. Not really the vibe I'm going for when I want to get my irish on, but I appreciated the clean bathroom when disaster struck. TMI. Real talk.

Drinks are reasonably priced.
author: Misha T.

description:
After a six and a half hour flight, the wait for luggage at SFO, and the cab ride to the Mission, I was ready for some good food. My concern was that it was a Friday night 8:30. I decided the best plan of action was just to start walking and see where I ended up. And that plan worked to my advantage.

I've walked, or been walked depending on one's perspective, by The Liberties more times than I care to think about and never once stopped by. Why? I have no reason except to say that I get stuck in my food ruts. They were, of course, busy, but they were more than happy to find me a seat. Thank you!

As it was coming up at midnight East Coast time, I didn't want anything too heavy though the bangers and mash sounded good. I decided to go with their grilled cheese sandwich, a bowl of tomato soup, and an order of tater tots. Oh of course I ordered a tequila and tonic. My new favorite cocktail, for those not in the know, but I digress, back to the food.

The tater tots were cooked to perfection. The tots were golden brown and crisp on the outside and soft and tender on the inside and served with a side of chipotle mayo, which was spicy and warm and just matched the tots in perfection. The grilled cheese sandwich on sourdough bread was again golden and crisp on the outside, and oh so cheesy on the inside. To add more yummy in my tummy, the tomato soup was thick without being chunky. Topped with parsley and croutons. It was the absolute perfect meal. 

Oh and their cocktails, at least my tequila and tonic was top notch.

If you're at the edge of the Mission and hungry for some great pub food, The Liberties is the place to go. From the friendly service to the great food and drinks, you won't find a better place in the surrounding blocks.

My rating...3.5 Paws

With love from my dog bowl to yours....Happy eating.
Shatasdogbowl.
author: DJ S.

description:
DON'T GO HERE TO WATCH NINERS GAMES.

This place has really taken a turn for the worse recently.  I've been going here for about 3 years. I don't like that I'm giving them 1 star, but my last experience there was really quite awful. 

When you have a bar full of fans eating and drinking, all of whom want the sound of the game on, you put the sound of the game on.  The owners weird rule against it makes no sense to me.  Here's the breakdown:

The location of this bar dictates that it will be a local spot, and not a 'destination spot'. So you'd think the owners would take steps to encourage and cater to locals.  This includes locals that go there to watch football games.  There are a lot of places to watch the games, and this place is no longer one of them. I will not go to this place to watch games again. Neither will my friends that watch games with me....that's a lot of lost revenue.  This sucks because some of the employees there are really very nice.  It's not the employees' fault they have to follow these rules.
author: S. T.

description:
I have to agree with the other reviews and advise this isn't the place to watch the big game. I have rolled up to Liberties as a place to watch the game when I don't want to battle the crowds and it was cool, NOT anymore.  The woman running the bar/seating was straight up mean. I watched her be rude to customers and even saw her YELL at a patron who had a table full of food and beer for him and his soon to arrive companion about saving a seat when the place was EMPTY. That is not how you treat customers, actually it's not how you should treat people. I would like to note I observed this behavior on more than one game day so it wasn't a one time fluke.

I will say the food was up a notch from last time.  I want to like this place. I am not sure if the person I saw was the same person responding to these reviews but if your actions and demeanor were closer to your responses that may help.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Yummy food and delicious drink selections!

We came here on a Saturday night with a large group.  Made a reservation for 10 people so they sat us in the loft/booth area across from the door so our rowdiness wouldn't bother other patrons in the restaurant!

The waitress was attentive and nice, and quickly took our drink orders.  I like how we were given large glass bottles of water so we didn't have to wait for water refills!

For drinks, I tried Liberties Summer Lemonade, and it tasted like real lemonade!  Yes, there might not have been that much alcohol in it, but the lemon wedge and the sugar rimmed glass made the drink soooo delicious and refreshing!

Their Irish Coffee was a little strong... Even though it's an "ice cream" drink, the coffee was still hot.  However, the hot and cold sensation was interesting and the Jameson was... helpful.

Another drink that looked really good was their Raspberry Mint Gimlet - I really wanted to try it but didn't get a chance to.  It has raspberry puree in it!  It seemed like a perfect summer cocktail :)

For appetizers, we ordered sweet potato fries, calamari, and rosemary garlic fries.  Their rosemary garlic fries were so good!  Really hot, but the fries (they're more like steak fries - thick and hearty!) were really fragrant and the herbs just made the fries really tasty!  I also like their sweet potato fries as well, but they were a bit - standard, just like the calamari.  Great appetizers nonetheless!

I had Curried Samosa, and it came with a little salad.  Wow, it was REALLY good!  I had dinner prior to coming here but I still finished all of my food!  The samosas had Irish bacon, pudding and curried mashed potatoes in them.  It was fried to perfection - golden brown and super crispy, and really crunchy was I cut open the samosa.  The curried potatoes inside were a little spicy, however, the cool mint cilantro dip it came with really balanced out the heat!  The salad was fresh and came with light dressing, which I loved because I don't like my veggies drenched and soggy!

I tried my friend's cottage pie - next time I come, I will get this!  It has the perfect blend of ground beef AND ground lamb, and the lamby flavor was not overpowering at all!  Eating it almost made me feel like I'm in a barn with sheep baa'ing next to me!  I also loved the slightly baked mashed potatoes on top of the meat pie - so creamy yet slightly browned, making it a little crispy, definitely added texture!  It also came with a side salad!

I also tried a little bit (yes, I was picking at other people's food alllll night) of their chicken curry with rice.  It was pretty standard.  I do like that they used long grain rice, so it's not all mushy - since curry tends to do that to rice!

At the end of the night, they were really courteous to let us sort of "split up" the payments - people could pay with separate credit cards - just let the waitress know how much to put on each card.  I thank them for doing that for such a large party!!

One thing to be aware of is that they have a small kitchen, so your food/drinks might take a little longer to arrive (they also state that on their menu!), but we didn't wait too long at all!  Our food arrived unexpectedly fast despite their little disclaimer :)

The food is reasonably priced, and I will definitely come back and try some more of their Irish dishes - I can't wait till my next visit!
author: Peggy S.

description: I value 3 things in life: great whiskey, great food and great people. Luckily for me I stumbled across this neighborhood gem that went 3 for 3 in my book. My husband and I tried a number of different items to eat and was very impressed with the quality of their food. I was most impressed with the barrel aged whiskey. I am always a bit skeptical when a waitress up sells me on a drink but let me be the first to say that it is worth it's weight in gold. The barrel aged old fashioned is unmatched. I have been back several times and I am yet to be let down. The service is fast, responsive and makes me feel right at home. This is a great place at the right price. I recommend it to anyone passing through the mission.
author: Kelly K.

description:
You might want to avoid Liberties on game days. The owner was extremely stressed about how the evening was going to go tonight. She kicked me out and screamed at me before she even opened for business. Sad really. I've dropped a lot of money here over the years and have never been treated so rudely. I will never be back. Maybe this is why none of the staff was there at opening.
Too bad.
author: Monet A.

description: Grabbed brunch here with friends on Sunday. It was pretty empty, which makes it a good choice if you're looking for a brunch place in The Mission where you don't have to wait an hour for a table. Plus they had a good deal on Mimosa Buckets. Their Chorizo Breakfast Burrito was decent, the Tater Tots even better.
author: Seth G.

description:
Granted that I've only been here a few times mid week, I definitely feel it deserves more than the 3 stars it has. The bartender is always attentive and the food especially at 1am, is well worth the visit.  I can't put my finger on the type of phone who come here other than those who just know a decent neighborhood spot.

The drinks are good, the food is good, the service is no less, and im happy to have visited this little gem during my stay on Guerrero.
author: Sheila P.

description: I can never resist ordering something to eat because it's a fun menu. However, I am drawn to this restaurant-style modern pub because they pour one of the best pints of Guinness in SF. I never seem to guess the rhythm here; it can get super crowded and other times I've braced myself for a wait and noise yet found it surprisingly easy to get a table and enjoy a relaxing stay. I've always found the service to be efficient and friendly, no matter how busy.
author: Sonya B.

description: Great Brunch selection. I personally love their crab cake Benedict....delicious! Good drink specials too.
author: Danny C.

description: Great Brunch place. Not over crowded, reasonable food, tho coffee would deserve to be better...
author: Nicolas B.

description:
The liberties bar, I would live here if I could. Friendly staff, alcohol, annnnd food is served til 1am! You are set for the night. Take a break from the taquerias at midnight and try this place out. It's a short walk or quick lyft ride to this hidden gem on Guerrero. 

Also if you didn't know, they serve breakfast on weekends.  And that breakfast pizza paired with a Bloody Mary may possibly be the hangover cure of a lifetime. 
Other options you can't go wrong with are just the basic two egg breakfast or a good old Irish breakfast! 

Other must try's:  Carne pizza, bangers & mash and those tacos on Tuesdays!
author: Chrissy C.

description: Great neighborhood pub.  Great spot to watch a game......but they just instituted a rule that they only show local sports games.  Nothing national - if the Giants are playing, forget watching the NCAA tourney.  I get the rube love, but c'mon, 4 TVs. One could show the national game.  Unless SF is so insular to not be able to watch national broadcaster games.
author: Bill S.

description:
like the place, got a new look and its pretty nice. Food however is poor.
Food was way too expensive for what you get.
author: Peter R.

description: Service was the slowest I have ever experienced.  Sat there for a good 10 to 15 minutes until I was able to get a menu.... Meep.  Food was okay, small happy hour menu, and probably won't frequent this place.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
I've gone here a couple of times for Sunday brunch and it's turning into one of my favorite spot. It's not busy and loud like some of the other places and for being a bar, their food is really good. I usually get the crab haven or the crab cakes and DAMN those things are big. Well not that big but much bigger than other places I've been. And it's actually very good portion and so much crabs are condense into it. I've also had their pulled pork sandwich and it just melts in your mouth goodness. The best thing is definitely 2 champagne bottles for $20 to have mimosas. They give you the options of taking the second bottle with you in case you can't finish it all. Just because they give you the option doesn't mean I take it.

If you're looking to have a good brunch and a nice buzz and not wait in some ridiculous 2 hours line, this is a nice place to go. No reservation needed. Parking could be tricky though since it's on a major street.
author: Nam T.

description: Solid food and drink in unpretntious atmosphere. Good beer selection. Stiff pours. Good service.
author: Wesley S.

description: Here for drinks. I liked the place, cool mixed drinks, drinkable tap selection. Late night food selection.
author: Will D.

description:
$4 Micro Stouts, open late, and there's room at the bar on a Sat night. 

It's loud enough to be fun, but not so loud I couldn't have a conversation with my friend. That's a delicate balance to get.

They have crazy ass pinatas on the ceiling so I love their decor. 

It's the perfect hipster, Mission, dive bar.

I'll come back.
author: David A R.

description:
Liberties is my favorite brunch place in SF.

Really friendly people
Solid menu options ( love the breakfast pizza)
$14  bucket of mimosa
No lines (hard to believe)

This place is my favorite "go-to".  
The mimosas have spoken.
author: Grandma E.

description:
The appetizers here aren't bad, unfortunately everything else here goes from mediocre to really sketchy.

I was excited to see a bar that served milkshakes and icecream, but the milkshakes were made with completely melted icecream, some texture would have been nice. The ginger icecream however, what was the excuse for it being completely melted? It came in a cup like the milkshake. What kind of icecream is drinkable? eck. 

The service was the really sketchy part. We asked for our bill to be split 2 ways and they simply refused. That's a minor inconvenience, so no big deal. However when the bill did come, it was unitemized. I signed the check with tip and asked for an itemized receipt so I could get paid back for other people's portions, and when it came I realized that 18% gratuity had been added. Really terrible, deceptive business practices. If you add gratuity, don't give the customer a receipt with only one number on it!
author: Teng L.

description:
It always bugs me here that you can't sit at the tables here outside and have a beer without being forced to order their (mediocre) food.  And not even like "split a plate of aps" and have a beer and sit outside- the rule is one entre per person for outside seating.  They claim it's a city regulation of SF, however I suspect it may just be a ploy to sell more food.  

Anyway- nice enough bar otherwise.  Calm, never too crowded, friendly enough staff.  Decent beer.  

Good place to meet and catch up with a friend or even get some work done.  Has a nice relaxed vibe and you can actually hear your friends talk!
author: Alex J.

description:
Amazing food! Had the fish and chips when I first went there and I was hooked! Then I explored the menu with trying the sliders, sweet potato fries, and tater tots. 
Service was also amazing. Waitress was on point with checking up on my party and I. Food came out quick and delicious. Definitely a place to either wind down after long day or even get a couple of drinks to get the night started!
author: Stacey W.

description: An all right choice to grab a beer... They don't have a particularly wide-ranging selection, however, and cocktails are quite expensive.  Service was also super slow when we went-- took about 15 minutes for them to bring us four beers.  Worth a stop if you're in the area and are looking for a drink, but I wouldn't recommend this place as a destination.
author: Allison M.

description:
I can't speak for this place in general, but it has a good happy hour.

I checked in on facebook to receive a special of $5 vodka martini (other specials were 50% off tecate and 50% off an entree on your second checkin)

Daily happy hour specials:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pZG78wgSEeMD4gWZ85Fs0w?select=lXyDeiDD1xifrYsYlR7UAg

2pm-6:30pm food happy hour menu includes regular and sweet potato fries and you can add aioli or various dipping sauces:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pZG78wgSEeMD4gWZ85Fs0w?select=WGO50ikDHdUCVTjY6gCiXg

whiskey flights:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pZG78wgSEeMD4gWZ85Fs0w?select=_phlL-vgzK4qLSocgYsjCg
author: Kimberley D.

description:
Late night food FTW. 

They have calamari, quesidillas, buffalo wings, samosas, burgers, fries...the whole nine yards when you're hungry and it's past midnight. At that point, any food is good..especially when it's deep fried.

The best things to get (that aren't that greasy) are the wings and the curried samosas. The samosas have sweet potato in them (unique!) and they're very memorable. They serve food till 12:45 or so which is sweet on that side of the Mission because it's either that or a bacon fried hot dog from a sketchy cart. 

Drinks are cheap-ish and the service is okay.
author: Joy A.

description:
My friend and I had to wander around the Mission for many, many blocks before we could find any bar that wasn't stuffed to the gills with hipsters, bros, or a sad combination of both.

There was an empty table right by the front door. No need to run any gauntlet of drunks. On a Saturday night, most bars in this area make you feel like you're trying to stumble through a mosh pit. This place was much more relaxed. 

Their beers were alright. The Liberty Ale was a bit too bitter for my liking (I'm a wuss, I like girly drinks!), but it was $5.50 for a pint and got the job done. 

If you're looking to dance or pick up someone, this is probably not your pub. If you're just out on the town and looking for a chill place to carry on a conversation, The Liberties is a decent choice.
author: Brandi W.

description:
If I lived in this particular neighborhood, there's no doubt in my mind that I'd quickly become a local fixture at the bar of this quaint pub on the corner of 22nd and Guererro in the Mission. 

Is it because of the food? Yes, but not entirely.

Is it because of the great drinks? Sure, but they're status quo with what you'd come to expect at any watering hole.

Is it because they have some of the friendliest employees on the planet? Yes, yes yes!

A genuine smile can go a long way, and the people that work here at the Liberties are the salt of the earth. They're all extremely friendly and totally down to earth. The kind of place that will remember your name, your favorite drink, and even be there to talk about life's little mysteries that only your neighborhood barkeep can shed light on to make sense of it for you. That's not to say that you should roll in there and dump your drama on their front stoop, but I'm willing to bet they'd hear you out and even try to offer some words of wisdom in your desperate time of need.

It's not just the people, though, as they serve some top notch pub grub that completely exceeds the usual menu items like nachos and dang quesadillas http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QUoyioYEggU&feature=related. In fact, I'd argue that they might have some of the best bar bites in the immediate proximity. Some of the nosh you can expect to find on their menu includes quality bangers and mash, curried samosas with "pudding," (a.k.a. blood sausage), Irish potato pancakes, sweet potato fries and tons more! Plus, their kitchen is open until 1:00am every single night, so if you're not feeling the usual late night burrito gut bomb, stumble a few blocks from the main vein of the mission and enjoy a quality cooked meal into the wee morning hours.

It's a small joint, so it has a tendency to get slightly packed on the weekends. Like all bars in San Francisco, your best bet is to enjoy the place during the week for post-work happy hour.
author: Ruggy J.

description: Ok, I came back here to meet a friend for food and drinks, and the experience was pretty great. I now recommend The Liberties with no reservations.
author: Dan S.

description: Love the Liberties! Trendy atmosphere and excellent tapas style small plates. The remodel has really revamped the place-comfy boothes and outdoor seating! I also really like their brunches because of the $6 bloody Mary's which are my favorite. Now I get to sip them outside even in winter because of the heat lamps.
author: Chloe A.

description:
A bunch of my girlfriends came in on Sunday for Brunch and Mimosas for my birthday and this place was a BLAST... 

$12.00 for a bottle of champagne and a carath of orange juice - awesome. 

I had the Crab Cakes benedict and it was the best thing I've ever had in my life. 

Definitely come here if you're looking to have a nice Sunday Funday with the gals. 

They had us seated in the back room where we had our own area to ourselves equipped with a TV of our own. 

Can't wait to come back!
author: Cat G.

description: Good food, great drinks, easy atmosphere.  Liberties feels like the kind of place you want to have right around the corner, even if it isn't really a destination spot.  I highly recommend the samosas.  Every cocktail we ordered was very good.
author: JP C.

description: Heard some things about this place and decided to check it out! We had the calamari to start and it was really good! We came on a Monday and they advertise on one of the menus that if you download and check in on the "LoyalBlocks" app (on Monday) you get half off pizzas! So guess who got a pizza! Haha we had the asparagus, bacon and goat cheese pizza and it was amazing! We also tried the croquettes and mac and cheese. My boyfriend really liked the croquettes but we weren't fans of the Mac n cheese.. To finish off our server recommended dessert so we had to do the 5 layer chocolate cake and OhMiGosh yes! The food was great and our server Marin was amazing! Very tentative and helpful! We will definitely be back!
author: Lala M.

description: Nice atmosphere with very clean, new furniture and decor and friendly staff.  But service was slow and I got cranky.  Music was a bit too mellow for my taste though some people like that.  I asked the bartender for a second drink cause our waitress was busy.  He said, 'Sure', then never made it.  He stood there talking to the patrons at the bar instead.  So I just cashed out and we walked to 500 Club, more my speed
author: Bradley W.

description:
Permission granted.

To smother a very reasonably priced $17 grilled salmon and spinach dish with a mustard based sauce. Very good. Avoiding the equally good mashed potatoes was hard.

To accept my Blackboard Eats discount event though it was a few minutes past the end time. All part of friendly and attentive service.

Let freedom (and good food/service) ring.
author: Jason B.

description: A decent bar. My friend and I dropped by a few weeks ago for some after-dinner drinks. The whiskey selection was pretty good, and the bartender was more than happy to walk us through a few options. I'd be back, menu looked like it had a few good pub food options.
author: Bill H.

description: While in San Fransisco with my ninja for Thanksgiving we came across The Liberties Irish Bar. Unfortunately, the bar was severely understaffed. The poor waitress was keeping up as best as she could, especially being the only one attending to the entire place. Not exactly sure how she managed to maintain a fantastic attitude, but she did. I never ended up getting the fancy Gingerbread drink I ordered... Next time I go to an Irish restaurant I will make sure to order an authentic Irish dish, instead of the veggie burger! Photos on my blog - go look!
author: Catherine S.

description: Best Burgers in SF and the bartenders are really nice and also make great cocktails.
author: Candace C.

description: Although I wasnt moved by the service here, the food was pretty good and they have flights("paddles") of beer, 4 types of your choice in 5 oz. glasses. This place had some unique variety to the menu and i was content with the food. All in all a good place.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Pros: nice atmosphere, great location. 
Cons: Everything else. 


- Horrible burnt food with no flavor whatsoever
- Dirty glasses and silverware
- The worst bloody marry I have ever had
- Overpriced considering quality

Suggestions for the owner: insist on fresh ingredients, higher cleaning standards, and pay closer attention in the kitchen. Never serve burnt food- it is just unacceptable.
author: Saray D.

description:
I thought the food used to be decent, but since they have changed their menu, its pretty bad.

The Fried Chicken Sandwich came on this white, textureless bread (the type you can buy in bulk for cheap), and the bread was so try that it started crumbling and falling apart as I was eating the sandwich. The chicken was dry and the breading had zero flavor. In general, the entire sandwich was just bland from both a flavor and texture standpoint. It came with fries that were ok, but they barely gave you any ketchup. I obviously could have asked for more, but I was just surprised they gave you so little to start with. Also, it cost $14, which is definitely on the high end for a sandwich and fries in the area.

I've also had one of their pizzas (can't remember which one). It was super oily, but tasted ok. However, it was $17 bucks for a pretty small pizza, which was surprising.

In general, the food is now extremely mediocre, and way overpriced.

Two stars for their willingness to put on whatever game you want (and having several TVs), and having an ok drink selection (also overpriced though).

Skip it, there are better bars in the area. I won't be back.
author: Will B.

description:
Checked this place out after Ike's Place (best sandwiches in the Bay).

Was looking for their curry french fries but was told by one of the two hostess that they stopped serving them. Then the other hostess said they started to sell sweet potato fries.

When she said that, everything went into slow motion. It was like a scene from The Matrix. Then she said, "we have the best sweet potato fries." I almost fainted out of laughter. Did she just say that? It felt like she was that one old cowboy sportscaster who called those college female basketball players the bad word which I wanted to point in her face and tell her to take it back! 

*calms himself down*

I apologize for I know this is a family site. I couldn't believe she would say such lies in front of me. So we decided to stay and try out the "best sweet potato fries" knowing in my heart that my love of Zebulon's SPF cannot be beaten. 

We ordered the SPF and some alcoholic shake. She said the Chipotle sauce was the best. So being the open-minded person that I am, I tried the fries. I felt like I was stabbing Zebulon in the back but really, I was only trying to prove a point. The point was, no one has anything on Zebulon SPF!!!

Still the BEST SPF in the Bay!! The fries were all right but it lacked something. The "best sauce" tasted like a Chipotle/mayo mixed. The shake, came in a martini glass. It was $11 for a gulp! I would have gone to Burger Bar and spent $8 on a shake than the alcoholic shake I had here.

I was so bummed for the SPF and mad that I was lied to that I ate my other half of my Ike's sandwich. I needed something delicious to down the so-called best SPF with. 

When the hostess came to give us our bill, she saw that we were eating our sandwiches and said, "you guys are tricky with your sandwiches!" I wanted to say, "well, that's what you get for lying to us about having the best SPF!"

I'm not mad at the hostess because she just didn't know any better. I should take her to Zebulon one day and she can taste the absolutely best SPF and Chipotle sauce in the world....
author: Jay C.

description:
Libertiesssss! I haven't been back since they canceled the Brainstormers trivia night. Before I go any further, I'd like to point out that my team, Finchy Lager, was the reigning trivia champion at Liberties. We went on to compete in the city-wide finals last year to officially represent the bar. We placed fifth.

Obviously you can tell from my reviews that I'm super smart, so I'll stop bragging about it. I will say I wish they would bring back trivia night though, because I loved doing it here.

The food is really great pub food. I'm a fan of the bangers and mash, and the cottage pie is also really good. The beer selection is standard and always served frosty. The servers are pretty on top of their game and really nice, despite the fact that trivia night was always bananas. I'll be back because I still have some Brainstormers gift certificates I won from being smart, but I'm scared to go because I know it won't be the same.

Dave of Brainstormers, if you are reading this: You broke my heart, buddy.
author: Rebecca P.

description: Stumbled upon this place with empty stomachs and left full and happy. Decent prices, food was done well, bloody mary was good. Not sure why this place wasn't more crowded than it was.
author: Jake B.

description:
One star for the crabbie's ginger beer which I can' t find anywhere else in the city. Terrible, inattentive service borders on rude. Bar was not crowded, only thing that was prompt was the check.

Update: Within an hour of this review I had a message from the owner. Really impressed with her follow up and look forward to visiting again with better results.
author: Teicho S.

description: For a place so close to Valencia street, it's not too crowded, and has a wide selection of drinks that aren't overpriced. The food is not anything to write home about, but the fact that the kitchen is open until 1am, the friendliness of the staff, and the casual atmosphere make it a great place to go for some late night food or for some low-key conversation with a friend.
author: Keito U.

description:
This place is an excellent weekend brunch spot that is much less busy than the places on Valencia, but is only one block away. Irish breakfast, buckets of mimosas (literally the whole bottle) and an excellent selection of cocktails with outdoor seating and prompt service.
We went for brunch and enjoyed the food very much- large portions- and as we were leaving, the waitress came running after us: I had left my wallet on the table and she ran through traffic to give it back. Totally the best service ever, thank you soooo much! We will most definitely recommend this place to others and come back again ourselves. Good food, good prices, great selection and excellent excellent service.
author: Emily G.

description:
Interesting combinations: Irish potato pancakes with various egg toppings for brunch; curried potato somosas with mint sauce. Very fresh and very nice combinations. We saw lunch food go by that we want to try.

Nice inside (very woody), sports TV's muted and not at eye level (so one can ignore them). The server was prompt and friendly. The menus warns that the kitchen is small and makes food to order, so the slightly slow delivery time was fine. Plating was okay. A little loud at brunch; probably more so in the evenings.

At one point, the server noticed that the music was too loud and immediately had the bar turn it down. Obvious, simple, perhaps, but heartbreakingly rare.
author: Richard H.

description: 5 stars solely based on the EPIC playlist they have. Classic outKast, Kanye Tupac, etc. oh, and awesome beers too!
author: David C.

description: My neighborhood gem!!! Love The Liberties!  The calamari and the sweet potato fries are GREAT - especially over a beer from their large draft beer selection.  Brunch is great - mimosas are CHEAP and they great eggs bene - even crab bene!  They have free wifi - which when I was a student was convenient - although I never took the time to "hang out on their wifi" more than a couple of minutes.  Great place to watch the Giants game or end the evening.
author: Ashleigh M.

description:
This place has gone completely downhill.  

Horrible service even though they weren't busy.  I think the food aspect is too much for them to handle and the owner(s) clearly don't trust the staff.  

The waitress knew we were dealing with gluten allergies, brought us food we couldn't eat, and still had to charge us because, "We aren't allowed to comp anything once it has been run through the register."  

Disempowered servers = dissatisfied customers = don't bother supporting this business.

You are probably better off treating it like a sports bar where you don't have to have any expectations.
author: M M.

description:
Five truths and a lie about The Liberties

- One of the best Bloody Marys in San Francisco
- Kitchen is open late (1am?) all week long
- Irish breakfast burritos (!!)
- Awesome bar snacks-- at least a half dozen small plates under $7
- Getting in for Sunday brunch is a breeze because hipster/breeders are all at Boogaloos
- Free porn
author: Ryan P.

description: A good neighborhood bar with good food.  The drinks are reasonably priced.  They make a good old fashioned and on Wednesday they're $7.  Some of their solid menu items are the full Irish breakfast, tater tots, fish and chips and fungi pizza.  Great spot to catch a Giants game and get some grub!  They have outside eating with alcohol service as well.
author: Timmy C.

description:
Came here for the taco Tuesday's for a quick meal and buzz. Did not disappoint. The waitress however was a kook. She mumbled to herself half the time, forgot that we had already ordered/brought us the wrong food, and was just way up in space the whoLe time. So besides that drug induced mess the place was actually pretty awesome. Tacos were tasty. The tequila+beer special was great as well.
 Really liked the seating area away from the bar for a more meal deal. I'm happy to see the other specials they have going on the rest of the week. 
Will hit this place again for sure.
author: Diana M.

description: Only rating here on food to go. This place is down the street from me and I needed some comfort food so I got the tomato soup and grilled cheese with a side of fries. The fries were terrible. I'm not a fan of thick cut but besides that they were tiny and overdone. The soup was put into a to-go coffee cup and was actually just fine but why not just invest in what you need to show that you give a shit about service? Anyway it was supposed to be garnished with croutons and maybe other things but I didn't get any. The grilled cheese was bad. It tasted..weird and was burnt. I couldn't even finish half of it. Boo.
author: Ashley M.

description:
Like this place a lot. Good food (yummy sweet pototoe fries), great happy hour, friendly staff.
As the 4 days of an SF summer is upon us, was glad to see how they feature their outdoor tables here on Yelp, so was gonna check it out.
But then read one of my fave local bloggers posted they told him you have to buy one food item per drink to sit on the tables outside.  So yah, I'll enjoy and drink there again. At night.  Late.  When there's no sun.
author: Lo W.

description:
Came here for some post dinner drinks. The Liberties was one of the first places we have been satisfied with (my roommates and I.)
They serve aged cocktails, which I found to be an interesting twist. My understanding is that they make cocktails in bulk then age them in a whiskey or oak barrel. We got the aged cocktail flight/sampler, which came with a Manhattan, a Grouse, and an Old Fashion (my favorite.) I also had an aged Negroni, which honestly tasted like a regular Negroni. They have a nice looking happy hour, but we weren't there for that.
Definitely skip the margarita.
The food we had was nice. The fries were fresh, hot, and not too filling. The mushroom pizza was pretty good, but it was too small to share. I didn't really love the scotch egg. I just tasted too much sulfur from it, also I couldn't tell if there was bacon in/on it or not. My roommates, who are vegetarian, complained that there weren't many options for vegetarians.
The atmosphere was probably one of the best parts for me. We had just come from some trashy lounge place which was blaring obnoxious and loud music. Liberties had a MUCH more conversationally appropriate ambiance. There was no wait and the staff was friendly. Watch out for parking, it took a while to find.
author: Nik K.

description:
Happy hour=4 
Brunch=2

I've been here for happy hour a few times and thought the drink prices were good and I like their appetizers. 

I probably won't come back here for brunch unless I'm super hung over and can't bring myself to fry up a couple of eggs (it's a block from my house). The crab cakes benedict were, for lack of a better word, gross. I saw my friend struggling through hers and asked for a bite. Yuck. Tangy and sweet. My egg dish was served cold, and my fiancé's eggs were still raw. Our server was really nice though...
author: Sushi S.

description:
When my friend brought us here and said its another one of her home away from homes and I checked it on Yelp I wondered... Three star rating.. Hmm but this place is amazing.. We came here for our Monday brunch and ended up spending a long time here.. 

The three of us split one of the massive Beat and goat cheese with candied pecan salads and as my entree I had the vegetarian burger. The food was amazingly delish and after our first mimosa we all decided to shift gears and try some cocktails. TRY THEIR COCKTAILS! I had the best drink ever and best drink while in the city called a "Honey Ginger Buck". The bartender Emily was amazing friendly and though it was her first day and never made a Honey Ginger Buck or the pomegranate mojito that my friend had she did an amazing job.. 

Our bill came out to $134.. We had several cocktails.. just saying.. This too would be my home away from home if I lived here!
author: Christina S.

description:
Hmmm. Have been here a few times; most recently this afternoon. Probably my biggest issue is that it's inconsistent. 

Generally when you go to a bar or a pub, you expect the servers to be attractive, no? All due respect, that's just not the case here.

Service has been speedy and prompt (as it was today), but it has also moved at a glacial pace (on prior ocassions). 

Food is...well, it's pub food. But you know, that shouldn't be an excuse. Varsity in Los Angeles is a sports bar and their food is on point. Lagasse's Stadium in Vegas is a sports bar and their food is stellar. My mom ordered a muffin with lox and it came out more brown-ish than pink. What can you really say about that?

There are at least two flatscreens that I noticed, but they're placed at sort of strange angles, rather than clearly visible to all. 

On the whole, I support this place for being a local business. But ultimately, they really do need to step up their game.

You can trust me on this one; I'm an Elite. ;)
author: Sebastian L.

description:
Came here for happy hour to watch the first giants game of the season and was totally not impressed. The beer selection was only ok and the food was also only ok. We got fries, onion rings, sweet potato fries, fish tacos, and a pulled pork quesadilla.

Meh it was only ok.i wouldn't come all the way out here to come back.
author: Lisa C.

description:
We've scrummed at the Liberties on St. Patrick's Day and recently to unwind after a couple gigs.  Despite the annoying televisions (at least the volume is muted), Liberties is a decent stopover to relax with an adult beverage and have some decent chow before heading back to the homestead.  

Overall the venue and the fare are nice and tidy.  Bulletin!...you can have a conversation!  The draft beers I've sampled -- Guinness, Bass Ale and Anchor Steam -- are crisp and fresh.  Try the steamed mussels with a side of sweet potato fries...really good.  The boxty with salmon is OK...arriving with a generous quantity of salmon.  But the pancake is too thick and pasty. 

So...there's another $60 (including tip) injected into the local SF economy. You're welcome...glad to help out. That's two glasses of house Chardonnay, two pints of Bass, steamed mussels with fries and boxty salmon.  

Next time I'm going to ask why they don't offer my favourite Anchor Liberty ale on tap...The pub is named "Liberties," right? Hey, I'm just sayin...Ya know?
author: K P.

description: Quite possibly my favorite pub in the international waters between Noe and the Mission.  It's generally not packed off hours. They have french fries with curry sauce for dipping.  You can sit outside on a nice day and have a shepherd's pie and a refreshing beverage.  Food is served till 1 am.  The employees are super friendly.  It doesn't get to be a scene or a meat market (there are plenty of annoying options in the area for that).  Mondays it gets crazy with the trivia,  but if you need a last drink and some fried calamari, you won't find it anywhere else but here.
author: David S.

description:
This bar has amazing service and one of the best mussels and fries I have ever tasted. And I mean better than the mussels I have had in Belgium and Holland. The broth they come in - white wine and cherry tomato broth- itself is soooo good. Dip your fries in it if you like that style.
They have flights of beer that are great and pretty inexpensive. I really love it here! Definitely recommend it. And Pub Quiz on Mondays are great fun!
author: Nicky H.

description:
Definitely not an authentic Irish pub; this place is far too polished.  Yet by that same token, it has a beautiful ambience of polished dark wood.  Definitely a great place to impress work friends with your taste in scotch and all-around rugged elegance.  In fact, one of the reviewers had a work party here, which would be an excellent idea.

If you're here for the food, it's more refined than your average pub grub, with prices to match, but it's still really good, especially the boxty (potato pancakes) with salmon, and the service is casual and friendly.
author: Wes M.

description:
I had an amazing night here after work with some work friends last week. I don't remember the night but I do remember the bartender (Laura) I believe her name was. 

She had just enough sass and you could tell she was very seasoned. Some bartenders in this city shell up and walk away, others talk your ear off. This one was just straight up accommodating, and genuine. 

It was close to midnight and my friends and I were talking about grabbing pizza somewhere. Laura chymed in because she heard us talking about food, and immediately there was food menus in front of our face. She then said the kitchen was open until 1am and not too rush. It's like she had a sixth sense. 

Wow, an irish bar with an eclectic food menu. I recommend this highly to anyone who likes to mix in some munchies  with cocktails. We will be back for the food and the service. A home away from home definitely.
author: Carlos L.

description:
Hints for running a pub!

1) Ketchup is not expensive!
2) cruets are not that cute!
3) a tablespoon of ketchup doesn't go that far on a burger and fries!
4) (fairly) sober waiters are good waiters!

Thank you for your attention.
author: Molly B.

description:
Maybe I should have ordered the burger instead of chicken curry.

Maybe our waiter should have told us that there was a table of 30 ordering ahead of us and that it would take forever to get our food.

Maybe my friend shouldn't have asked for a substitution on her salad and they would have got it right the first time.

Maybe I'll try The Liberties again since it's right near my friend's new condo.

Maybe.
author: phil h.

description: All though the food was pretty amazing, the service was somewhat slow. I don't know if it was because the restraunt was filled because of the Warriors game, or something else, but the fact was that it took 20 minutes for the water that I ordered, to finally arrive. Besides that, the service was pretty good. I admired how the     Servers went out of their way to seat us, especially since we didn't have any reservations but were over excited to watch the game. The restraunt was really fabulous, beautiful, and definatly a place to revisit!
author: Shrey V.

description: This place is especially great if it's late and you're trying to find dinner. I've never had a problem grabbing a table. The Cottage Pie and the Veggie Burger are both awesome and the drinks are wonderful. The service can sometimes be a little slow, but the fact that it's so easy to get in and get great food more than makes up for it.
author: Zika R.

description:
Most likely the best roasted breaky potatoes in the city.... they have a true Irish breaky, white and black pudding as well... but it was the potatoes that really caught my attention..... 
I haven't been there for anything else but the Irish breakfast...looks like a good solid place... 
Any foods that are cooked will take a while as they have a small kitchen and they inform you of that before you order, which is appreciated.  I'll be back for breaky...
author: Blake J.

description:
The request for the night was a place that had a good bar, a decent crowd, and a good atmosphere, but not so loud that we couldn't hear each other talk. For the most part, The Liberties fit the bill. It's in sort of a quiet area, there was ample space for us at 11pm on a Sunday night (of a long weekend), and it wasn't crazy loud inside. A nice place to hang out and down a few drinks. The menu looked very interesting, although I didn't get to try anything. Maybe a cut above your typical gastropub menu. The bar is pretty well stocked, beers on tap were just run-of-the-mill stuff. 

Overall, not a bad place, but a few things didn't sit quite right. They were offering a $3 Jameson special, so I got that. But I think maybe it's $3 because they only pour you half a shot. Seriously. It was tiny. The other drinks were also somewhat pricey. For 2 beers and 2 cocktails, it was $30. Dang. Service was ok. 

We came on what looked like a slow night, so not sure if that factored into the experience.
author: Saunders C.

description: A neighborhood gem. Friendly faces, loads of space for gathering groups, family friendly, great whiskey selection, quality pub food (try the sweet potato fries).
author: David C.

description: This is a pretty neighborhood bar that serves alcohol.  That's all I got.
author: Tasha D.

description: I like their burgers and wings. It's a comfortable and classier place to watch the game. We like to do small work dinners here. They are polite and accommodating.
author: Chase L.

description:
I have no idea why this place doesn't have a higher ranking on yelp!

Okay, so its not the cheapest place for a beer on the block (oh, wait, the only other option is Lone Palm so it IS the cheapest place on this block), but that's only if you aren't ordering off the daily special menu. The owner of this place is hot on web advertising (Yelp and Facebook), so make sure to check in and take advantage of whatever deals they have going on.

My favorite specials include the 2 dollar tacos on tuesday - they are really good - and the 5 dollar bombay sapphire martinis. The bartender Jackie makes a pretty damn good dirty Martini.
