And I mean a lot of them! The restaurant was busy inside, and it appeared that they were understaffed. Our waitress took a long time to bring our drinks. The food took much longer. Then she brought the wrong entree for me. Which resulted in another 20 minute wait. The dish I had was plain and not very substantial. The accompanying salad was just greens with a few drops of salad dressing. To her credit, the waitress comped us our soft drinks because of the long waits. But most definitely we will not be going back for a meal.
author: Eric P.

description: An authentic Irish pub, especially considering the bartenders. Live music on Wednesdays. Good, if not fantastic, pub food.
author: Don H.

description: Solid, unpretentious Irish pub and pub food in the Mission.  Waiter was totally friendly, but not too friendly.  Reasonable veggie options.  Only downer is they put their martinis in a stainless steel "glass," which seemed kind of weird.
author: Aaron F.

description: Because I live a block a way, am Irish, and enjoy a good black and tan (which they do nicely I must admit) I want to give this joint another star or two, but I cannot. The food is not good. The fries were dry, cold, and tasteless. The veggie burger would have been average had it not been for the tag board-like texture of the bun. So much potential wasted.
author: Scout S.

description: My friends and I are regulars, mostly for the chance to spend a couple of hours in relaxed conversation without having to shout or elbow our way through hordes of drunken barhoppers. The food is fine but nothing to write home about; the drinks are small and weak, but *very* tasty (lots of sugary and creamy confections). The ambience, however, is spot on.
author: Chaney K.

description:
This place bums me out. The previous reviewer asked the question I've been wanting to ask, "When will the owner get a clue?". 

 I live in the hood and Liberties was once my staple burger place, good food and good prices. Over the past year and a half the quality of the food has dropped exponentially while the prices have risen.  The last time i tried a burger , for old times sake, they had stopped using Nieman ranch meat, the bun was brutally dry, and I had to question the waiter as to how he could serve the fries that were GRAY and completely soggy.

Such a shame.
author: cindy b.

description: I have been here for brunch and for pre-sat night cocktails.  I never actually go into the restaurant, i either sit at the bar or sit ousdie.  Nice place to relax before moving on to life's other pressing matters.  When i had brunch, it was your typical hearty hangover food and it tasted great! (could have been the hangover though)  Will go here again to chill out if i'm wasting time in that area.
author: Marci B.

description: I can't vouch for the food, but the menu made it look salty and greasy, which I think is a plus at a pub.  The beer selection was limited, but it had the basics plus a few oddities.  Overall, great service, plenty of room, and a friendly crowd.
author: Andi T.

description:
Wow, caveat emptor big time.

My friend and I went here for brunch this sunny Saturday morning and boy, were we disappointed.

We both ordered orange juice - or should I say TANG...

She ordered her eggs with the Hollandaise sauce on the side.  Came slopped right on top.  Our waitress noticed as she was putting her food down on our table.

My food came complete with a small clump of hair in the potatoes.  I'm sure the hair would have tasted delicious, but I wasn't in the mood.

We told the waitress "no thanks" and walked out - never to return.  I suggest you don't waste your time here.

On the only plus side, our waitress seemed very nice, and she understood when we decided to leave.
author: Jon B.

description:
The Liberties seems to be forever trapped in some kind of ongoing identity crisis.  When the place first opened, it seemed to be a restaurant with a bar added as an afterthought.  Later on it felt like a neighborhood pub with a dining area.  On my last visit, a non-green paint scheme and a subdued sound system playing predominantly ambient music gave me the impression that management was chasing the current trend of restaurant-lounge chic that's sweeping the Mission like an outbreak of chicken pox in a classroom full of second-graders.

Earth-tone walls, hardwood floors, and minimal use of decor create a nice space with a clean look.  Large windows facing Guerrero street make for a pleasant daytime vibe, and while a small amount of brewery-sponsored wall clutter is present, it doesn't dominate to the point of being overwhelming. The predominantly ambient music doesn't sit well  with an Irish Pub environment, but on the other hand it's conversation-friendly volume level is better suited to it's restaurant side.  TVs are oddly placed...and equally split between American and European sports.  The array of on-tap beer is good for this neighborhood and the liquor selection is better than average, but never having eaten here I can't vouch for the food.  As for the crowd, it's hard to draw a bead on. It was pretty lively during it's pub-with-grub phase, but it's gotten *much* quieter since entering it's present restaurant-lounge incarnation.  The crowd is usually a bit older and more sedate than you'll find further down 22nd Street, and the ratio of bar stools-to-patrons is noticeably higher.  

But an Irish Bar?  At the time of this review, it's status as such is debatable at best.   At the moment, you could change minimal elements of the decor and call the place English, Scottish, Welsh, or Italian with new patrons being none the wiser.  But if you're looking for a nice space rather than an Irish one, it's  worth checking out if you're in the mood to hide-out with someone special, and The Lone Palm across Guerrero street is a bit on the crowded side.
author: Mike W.

description:
So I'm a huge fan of most things Irish....my best friend, guiness, whiskey, even my ex-boyfriend of years ago and, of course, pubs and good pub food.  This place is great as far as friendliness and inexpensive drinks, but the food is...well...it's crap.  A friend reserved the room in the back(great little space) for a bachelorette kick-off party complete with "passed" hors d'ouevres....at $16 per head~ it was a disgrace.  Not only was everything brown, deep fried and dumped on a platter, but their idea of passed was the waitress(who was great by the way) walking past the guests and plopping it on the table.  
I saw the menu the hostess chose from and I'm not sure when pigs in a blanket became a substitute for a salmon avocado roll with lemon grass dipping sauce, but there was nothing even resembling salmon, avocado or anything with the slightest bit of lemon or grass...we would have welcomed the color of either.  
I tend to be a bit critical when it comes to food because it's my job, but the menu choices weren't honored and the way the food was to be presented was completely misleading.  In this case my disappointment is more than justified.  As for the price , they should be ashamed of themselves....we should have ordered fish and chips for $6 a plate and called it a night. 
Have a pint, hang out, chat with friends, reserve the back room even...just have a burrito down the street beforehand and call someone else to cater your events;)
author: Carrie P.

description: Got there late dinnertime-ish, stayed till midnight. Nice bar, good service, cute bartenders, good drinks.. I dont know what else you could want? Convenient location, spacious, nice atmosphere, good bar food. Good for dinner or getting shitfaced!
author: Jon S.

description: This bar makes me want to be Irish.  All the guys with sexy Irish accents.  Swoon!
author: Monica L.

description: The food isn't great, but the atmosphere kicks ass. I love the woody, homey feeling and the big back room that's almost always vacant -- making Liberty's a great place for an impromptu party. It's also my favorite place to catch a pint, burger and the baseball game. A word of advice: Don't try to eat healthy here, go with the Mission Burger (with real Irish bacon -- not that sissy Yankee stuff!) or the Fish n' Chips.
author: Katie B.

description: Where else can you get fish n' chips and a $6 fresh fruit margarita in the MIssion, served by an unpretentious bartender whose Irish accent is too thick to understand?  Medium crowded and a very neighborhood feel, people in this place have known each other for years.
author: Gil S.

description:
i love fish and chips - i won't apologize for it.  in San Francisco--it is low brow food-- but you know in London--it is the same thing.  the only difference between here and London is that in London the pieces are larger and here you get ketchup -- not there.  But this is not about London v. SF v. Dublin--it is an Irish pub--where i have always had good food. 

Buen Provecho!
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: Went back this last week on Tuesday night. Sat at the bar and had a burger, beers, and talked to the bartender. Not sure if I have ever had a more competent and inspiring bartender in my entire life. I don't know if this review is for the bar or the staff, but this guy knew everything about everything and couldn't have been more professional and hilarious at the same time. I drank more than I should have, which I guess is a testament to that dude behind the bar. Great staff, good food, and the best part it is relaxing. Thanks local pub place!
author: senator t.

description: It's totally official that I'm a sucker for the Irish anyhow.  But the CUTEST waitress sealed the deal on me hitting Liberties for breakfast as well as liquid dinners.  Get the omlette.  Get the burgers.  Whatever.  Eat and drink there, ok?
author: Tracy E.

description: Beer is good, mmmmmmm, lots of beer...something on  a plate arrives, we eat it while imbibing more. Bill comes, Jacksons on the table, exit left.
author: Colleen B.

description: Sometimes I end up here because I'm in a hurry and don't want to wait for a table and don't want a burrito. Everything about The Liberties is fine. Just fine. The food is so underwhelming. It's not horrible, there's just no reason whatsoever to eat here.
author: Nato G.

description: Anonymous F. and I end up here a lot of nights by default, even though neither of us love it all that much.  The acoustics inside are terrible -- even when not at all crowded (and it is seldom crowded), one loud person can ruin the whole place.  Also, the service is atrocious -- insanely slow and inattentive.  Despite the name, this is definitely *not* a restaurant -- it's a bar that serves food.  Having said that, the mussels are surprisingly good, and on warm nights the outside tables are lovely.  Plus, as already noted, it's almost never crowded, so nice for a catch-up drink and a chat.
author: Sarah B.

description:
five stars for: decent, reasonably priced bar food.  excellent service.  cozy nook where i can fit 6 of my closest friends.  the same wonderful waitress who is the perfect amount of efficient and cheer.  crispy calamari with horseradish sauce! (none of that marinara bullshit).  really yummy sweet potato french fries.  

listen i know this place seems a little out of its element on 22nd and guerrero and its definitely not a hipster bar.  older crowd in their 30s, babies, toddlers, but always a good mix of twenty somethings too and the attitude is just the more the merrier.  theres a little cozy nook up the steps where you can sit with big groups of people and no one cares, no ones waiting for a table and you can sit and laugh and talk with friends until last call when the bartender kicks everyone out in a very tough love but endearing fashion.

one of my favorite places.
author: Holly S.

description:
I can't comment on the Irish authenticity of the place - but I DO know the make a killer Espresso Martini. This cocktail is a rarity in this hood... so I was pleasantly surprised to find them so close to home 

And, if you have a hankering for something fried and delicious, try the tiger shrimp wrapped in Irish bacon and phyllo. 

Mmmm, mmm good.
author: J K.

description: Cute and comfortable neighborhood bar.  You can get some great quality bar food, along with some authentic Irish grub.  I heard they import product from Ireland.  They have a fun and happening bar with tvs and music, but they also have more intimate side rooms.  The happy hour specials are great, especially on food.  PLenty of great beers on tap.
author: jennifer k.

description: The Guinness is great here, however, it's a pint...not a microwave Hot Pocket...take a few minutes to pour it properly!
author: Tres S.

description: The liberties is one of my favorite bars...more of a pub i guess. it's so neighborhoodly, warm and comfy atmosphere. the food is decent too, especially the irish soda bread, though not the fish and chips.
author: sarah C.

description:
All you cheap, delicious burrito fans out there: set nary a foot in this speakeasy.

A coworker of mine insists that there is a burrito for every people. Well, if the world of burritos is a tepid melting pot of savory innards and sundry heart-attack-causing substances, the Irish Breakfast Burrito disappoints with low flavor and still elevated grease content.

The assembler of my Irish Breakfast Burrito must be a stickler for neatness and orderly patterns. All the eggs colluded in one end of the burrito, while the potatoes and pork products squatted on the other side.

Opt for the Crab Benedict or Boxty Pancake instead. Enjoy the lofty barstool seating and hope it buoys your mood as you lighten your wallet's load.
author: Mia L.

description: Really great fruit and berries cocktail. Food was delicious, ambiance is dimly lit and nice.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
THANK YOU very very dim candle lighting! I smashed up my face in a bike accident a a few days ago and drinks at Liberties was the best I've looked since. Half empty and laid back on a Wednesday night.

Given the fussy cocktail menu, I didn't even realize this place was Irish until an hour in. I had a Ketel One martini, which was a little on the watery side. The drinking made me hungry so I ended up trying the boxty, an Irish potato pancake, which was pretty delicious served with lox and maybe 10 cups of sour cream. Traditionally in Ireland, the boxty was considered to be a good way for single women to gain some weight so they could get a man. I'll come back and add a star if my boxty-thickened thighs land me a date.
author: Debbie K.

description: Me and 12 others piled in here late on a Friday and sat right down to beers, margies and one unfortunate strawberry daiquiri.  Coupled with friendly service and good peeps all around, there's nothing bad to say about Liberties.
author: Matt S.

description: Mixed drinks were good and there's a good beer selection.  The sweet potato fries were good - not too oily and crunchy but not at all burnt.  The fired calamari and bruschetta were good too.  They have a decent beer selection.  For Thursday happy hour, it wasn't empty but it wasn't at all hard to get a table.  Overall, a pretty solid experience - a very decent place to go when it's convenient.  Of course at 22nd and Guerrero parking can be pretty tricky, so it probably helped that we got a spot in 5 minutes.
author: Amy E.

description: Bloody Mary, spicy and good.  Fish and chips, crispy and good. Beer, hard to go wrong. I've had less than good food here too, but I'm not expecting great going in. It's a bar with TVs and food, sometimes that's exactly what you need.
author: Jen S.

description: This place is only worth a star for being 1) a block from my place 2) having decent beer on tap. All the dishes I've had here (never breakfast! why, when boogaloos is a block away?!) was mediocre, slow to arrive, slow to be cleared, etc. Service is lousy unless you just go and have a pint at the bar. That's the only use I have for an "Irish" pub. If you want good food, there are three four restaurants across the street, all of which (french, italian, vietnamese and japanese) have something to offer you for your time and money. skip the liberties, unless you're thirsting for a good beer.
author: A T.

description: Maybe it's because I watched the election returns in 2004 when Bush won that I have bad memories of this place. Or, perhaps it's the fact that everything seems to taste like fish. Even the quesadilla. The drinks are decent, and the staff friendly. Quiet and cozy (but can sometimes smell like fish).
author: Dana K.

description: We stopped by the Liberties last night for a couple of beers and some dinner.  Our server was attentive and friendly, our beers were super cold and the menu had a decent selection of typical bar food and more robust fare.  Both of our meals were served piping hot, though I was rather disappointed in the curry- not enough sauce and the chicken was all in one piece- I prefer the more classic preparation, as it allows the sauce to soak into the meat and you can sop up the tasty curry sauce with rice and/or fries.  My husband's sandwich was piping hot and well prepared.  Overall, we had an average meal with good beer in this comfortable (though somewhat lacking in unique charm) Irish restaurant.
author: Melissa L.

description: everytime im cruising up/down guerrero st...or @ the intersection~i see this place packed...people goin in/out...knowing me & my nosiness i had to stop by for a cocktail...after bi rite~had the itch for a drink...like the previous reviews said~its an excellent neighborhood bar...lil outdoor seating for the sunny days is a plus....the food menu looks yummy~ill b back for the fish/chips...the espn tv showin football is a plus...dunno why its called an irish pub tho
author: elmer d.

description: This place is cool.   Very neighborhood, laid back feel.  The food was OK (we both ordered the fish and chips as it appeared to be the best bet from other reviews).  Not bad, not great.  But I like the spot, and will probably go back.  Oh yeah, and they are open late, which is always a big plus
author: sam p.

description: Only came here for a meeting, so only had the curried samosas....which were delightful! Waiter was charming, though seemed a little pre-occupied at times...semi-private back room was perfect for the meeting...about ten of us there...dim lights were easily brightened by request...would definitely come back to check out more of the fare...
author: D M.

description:
I'm giving the food 2 stars.  I had the fish and chips.  They were served on the cool/cold side rather than hot/fresh..  The bread served didn't taste fresh or very good.  The ice tea tasted lousy.

I also would recommend that they hire at least a p/t bus person to help out with the tables when it's busy.

I think that it's probably just a good place to grab a beer with some friends.  The pub environment itself is fine, just don't go there to eat.
author: jayne a.

description:
What is wrong with getting good service at this place?  We went in again because it was the only place not busy and we wanted to just get a quick bite to eat.  

Horrible service again and they always mess something up and then they disappear and you can never find them.  I vow to never go to this place again and would recommend either going to Lone Palm or The Phoenix.  They both have a better crowd, prices, and service.
author: Michelle J.

description: The best kept secret in SF is "The Liberties" i go here all the time and quite often spend more time here than i do at home. It's so warm and comfortable and the bar tenders and servers make the place. I eat here about 3 times a week and have to say i worked my way through most of the menu and one thing that is for sure is the "Fish & Chips" is the best and that's why i keep coming back and the fact that i live a block away...
author: Andrew S.

description: I have been here a few times for brunch and I've always enjoyed the food, however the customer service has never been stellar, and last week it was so awful I've decided I'll never go back.  Most of the times I've  been there, it wasn't crowded and the staff seemed fairly capable of handling their few customers. However,  last week it was super crowded and I guess they just didn't know what to do with themselves.  We stood at the hostess stand for a good 15 minutes, and no one even bothered to look in our direction.  In fact, it seemed that the waitress intentionally did not make eye contact  with us.  We finally flagged some one down and asked if we were supposed to seat ourselves (which, if that is the case, don't have a hostess stand) and she managed to look at us long enough to say yes, but at that point, we were so annoyed and figured that even if we did sit down, it would take hours to get our food, so we left.  NOT WORTH IT.
author: Swaicha C.

description: I have a group of friends that like to come here from time to time and I usually tag along.  I'm really not a fan of the atmosphere here.  The music tends to be rather crappy, it's always pretty empty, and the place just feels rather dead.  The service is never phenomenal, to the point of a friend of mine waiting 20 minutes when he asked for another beer last night.  That being said, the food makes up for it.  If you're looking for some great comfort food on a cold night, you'd be hard pressed to find better bangers and mash in the city.  You get three large tasty bangers, a nice portion of fluffy mash, and it's all topped with a slice of grilled onion and a perfect, slightly sweet, brown gravy.  It's a dish worth coming here for.  So in short, if you're looking for a good bar/pub to have a good time at, I'm not sure this is the best choice, but if you're looking for a place to get some great comfort food/pub gub, you could do a lot worse in this city than The Liberties.
author: Joshua W.

description: Well, it has finally happened. I had a bad time at an Irish Pub. This bar sucks and so does the service. Irish Pub my ass, this place would know Irish if you smacked it with a Guinness. Even the clientle leaves a lot to be desired. No disrespect intended to the people who gave it high marks, maybe I need to go when you are there. The first thing that annoyed me was when we ordered our first round, the waitress brought the drinks by and the bill. She stood there and WAITED for us to settle up immediately. She didn't ask us if we were ordering more drinks, just brought us the bill. That kind of behavior warrants a negative star. I didn't see this happen to anyone else, but in all honesty I wasn't paying that much attention. I ordered an Irish coffee, I asked for a spoon and sugar. Of course, I had to wait until the tab was settled until this arrived. Waitress, gets he spoon, I reach for it, hand open, palm up, she places it on the table. You probably don't know, but I am a minor germ-a-phobe. I am also big on manners. I say, I don't want the spoon placed on the table and ask for another one. Same thing happens. This time, I stop all conversation at the table, when I tell the bitch, that I don't want my spoon placed on the table. My friends blink, because I normally don't express this level of demand and anger. Bitch you see my hand open, right? She gets another spoon, hands it to me, I no longer look at her. She stands there and repeats a few times that there is already sugar in the Irish coffee. I ignore her. Bitch, I know there is sugar in the Irish coffee. EVERY bartender puts sugar in the Irish coffee, that doesn't mean I don't want more. Eventually she left. She never came back, which was great, cause she sucked, this place blew and I shall never grace it  with my black ass again.
author: Jocelyn F.

description: Please boycott this place due to the crazy owner!  We live in the neighborhood and have come to this restaurant for the past few years.  The owner is abusive to her employees and we have seen hundreds go thru there and they all end up quitting due to her abusive treatment.  Please spend your money where employees are treated with respect and not animals!
author: Alissa C.

description: i excpected more from an irish pub when it comes to fish and chips , we had few beers though and cant mess this up for sure ;)
author: NAEL K.

description: great food, mellow place to watch sports and election coverage for us locals who don't have tvs. the wine is a little pricy, and they only ever have one bartender working so if it gets busy you'll be waiting forever for drinks, but jerry is an excellent bartender and exactly what you want from your neighborhood irish pub. it's kind of a fancier irish pub, catering to the mission dolores/noe valley fare.
author: Amy P.

description: came here on a saturday night with the bf. wasn't packed which was nice. good drink selection, lots of girlie drinks which is essential to my enjoyment (liked the coconut colada) Didn't try the food so can't comment on it and the service was good.  If I'm in the area again I'd probably come back.
author: Marie W.

description: I like this place for after work on a Friday.  I only wish that they had a better selection of food.  It's comfortable and I really enjoy being in there.  Oh and they play good music too.  The only thing I wish is that I got out of work earlier so I could get a better table.
author: L G.

description: If only it were possible to give ZERO stars. This place is a wreck. Ok, I must admit, I went there hoping to score some dinner. BIG MISTAKE. I guess one should really limit one's expectations of an Irish pub to that which they do best: dispense copious amounts of alcohol. Still, my friend and I wanted a quick bite before heading to a movie and, living only a few blocks away, this seemed like an ok choice. I will preface this by saying that it was the day after St. Patricks day, so I suppose it's possible that the regular staff was taking a much needed day off after dealing with the frat boy invasion that I'm sure must have occured the previous night. Still, WHERE did they find their replacements? The closest sorority house? Another planet? No, really, I'm  not usually a mean person but PLEASE, the waitress had to be the dumbest individual I've ever encountered. Brief recap: 20 minutes to get our water (there were maybe 3 other tables at most). After asking for it twice, we finally went to the bar to get our own water and the waitress, seeing us do this, proceeds to go pour more water and bring it over to us (pretending to remember). Then, another 20 minutes pass and, still, no salad, no burger.  When we ask her if the food is coming out soon (since we were trying to make a movie), she seemed dazed & out of it) and replied "maybe". Uh, ok? Couldja check? She was too busy bopping around  The salad finally came out a good 10 minutes later--50 minutes after we ordered!! And, guess what?! Yep, she got it wrong! We didn't stick around to see if the burger came out right. We told the bartender we were leaving & went somewhere else. And, of course, missed the movie.
author: SL N.

description: So we're all dying from the night before, in dire need of a good Irish breakfast to help the hangover go away..... There's four of us, only 2 other guys in the bar, we order 4 irish brekkies, and tea "oh it doesnt come with beans? they're extra... hmmm ok, oh and mushroom is extra too, oh, right, well we'll have them anyway..............."  "excuse me? we didnt get our tea yet" (15mins later). Out comes breakfast after about half an hour, "excuse me, i didnt get my toast", out comes the cold toast, "oh and he's still waiting for his 'side' of beans", oh here they come, wtf, they're cold????!!!! "Excuse me, bartender, this guy here is still waiting 4 his tea! CHECK PLEASE! HOW MUCH! Are you guys serious?" Honest to god, between all the extra's they charges us it was like $75 EACH for breakfast!! WTF!!!! NEVER AGAIN - if i could give Zero stars i would 4 sure!
author: Maureen D.

description: really? 3.5 stars? really? you people are on the crack rock, and i'm gonna tell you why. let me start with this though - i used to go to the liberties back in the early aughts, and i would giggle and point at the tools corralled outside boogaloo's. why would you wait for 2 hours when you could walk one block and get perfectly good brunchy foods in a timely manner? now, flash forward to the present. natty, marc and i decide to revisit after several years of absence. natty and i both ordered the smoked salmon boxty (potato pancake with poached eggs and smoked salmon). i order an iced coffee to wash it down. normally i don't order iced coffee because often times you get hot coffee poured over ice so it's all watered down and blech. but they had it on the menu, and the way i see it, if you're going to put iced coffee on the menu it means that you have a pitcher of coffee in the fridge that's already cold. well i was wrong, i got hot coffee poured over ice. on to the food - i ordered my eggs poached hard, so they brought out natty's first since it took less time. hey look natty, you got bacon instead of salmon! too bad natty doesn't love the pig! they take hers back and switch the bacon for the fish and bring out mine at the same time. as i'm eating my eggs, it seems to me that i have a lot of yolk. after a little investigation, we figure out that i have 3 egg yolks and natty has 1. oops. the potato pancake was awful - the potatoes has been beaten so much that the starch turned to glue. i counted how many chews it too to choke one bite down - it was 25. even then the pancake just broke into smaller pieces. potato pancake came with a side of roasted potatoes, which tasted like they had been soaking in bleach water. the service was pretty terrible too. there was one waiter and one bartender - after the waiter took our drink orders he never looked at the table again. the bartender came out and finished our service. i'm never going back again.
author: sarah g.

description: worst. service. ever. the food was ok but don't go if you're hungry. i think they harvested the wheat for my veggie burger while we were waiting.  the atmosphere is dark and casual but the awful service kills the ambiance for me. maybe it's a good place to sit at the bar for a drink, but go next door to the lone palm if that's what you're looking for.
author: Izzy S.
